intro: Psychotria minimicalyx, commonly known as the dwarf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Psychotria minimicalyx is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
